meanings.definition: So small as to be visible only with a microscope.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the microscopic organisms under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a microscopic brush to paint the tiny details.
meanings.sent3: The microscopic ants decided to have a picnic on a grain of sugar.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so microscopic that she noticed every speck of dust.
meanings.sent5: The microscopic stars twinkled in the night sky like glitter.

meanings.sent1: The microscopic particles in the air were too small to see without help.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a microscopic amount of salt to the dish for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The microscopic snowflakes fell gently on the ground, creating a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent4: His patience was microscopic when waiting in long lines at the store.
meanings.sent5: The microscopic details in the painting amazed the art critics.
